content.question: Which of the following is true of the German Peasantsâ€™ Revolt of 1524-1525 ?

choices.label: The revolt led to the emancipation of the German serfs.
The revolt was organized by Martin Luther to break papal power in the German states.
The peasants were supported by French armies during the revolt.
The revolt was the first in Europe in which economic egalitarianism was a major rallying point.
The revolt resulted from a combination of new religious ideas and peasant demands

content.answer: The revolt resulted from a combination of new religious ideas and peasant demands
